discussion_comments.comment_body: How about naming it `data()` in case this class turns into a Java Record in the future?
Can we replace `11` with a meaningfully named constant? Asking because it's sprinkled in a few places
If "valid mask not set" means "is valid" then maybe the `VALID_MASK` should be named `INVALID_MASK` instead?
I think you're right here that's a good point
I see the original code was using `int VALID = 0;` which mean that `isValid` was checking that valid was `==  VALID`.
Yes, but my comment still applies ;-)

Yep, i was trying to recollect why I have chosen such misleading name eheh 
I will happily fix it, thanks üôè
Is it the root path for openapi?

WebAuthn standard uses the name `PublicKeyCredential` for [other type](https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#publickeycredential).
COSE algorithm type should be `COSEAlgorithmIdentifier`.
https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn-3/#typedefdef-cosealgorithmidentifier
Absolutely, that's a mistake that I've no idea how it ended up there :-/
Ah, probably because the config parameter is named `pubKeyCredParams`, which, BTW I should change to a non-abbreviated name.
